channel.title: Tig and Cheryl: True Story
channel.description: Join Tig Notaro (One Mississippi, Star Trek) and Cheryl Hines (Curb Your Enthusiasm) as they discuss a new documentary every week, with plenty of hilarious diversions and memorable stories along the way!

item.title: Haunters: The Art of the Scare
item.description:
Happy Hallowe'en, True Story listeners! Tig and Cheryl scare their way through "Haunters: The Art of the Scare", a doc about the spooky world of DIY haunted houses. Will poooop come back to haunt Tig and Cheryl? What's on their mind these days? All that and more, on a hauntingly hilarious episode of True Story.

*this episode spills beans* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

  • Follow the show:
  • Instagram: @tigandcheryltruestory
  • Twitter: @TandCTrueStory

item.title: Beanie Mania
item.description:
Today on True Story, Tig and Cheryl spill ALL the beanies as they discuss "Beanie Mania," the HBO doc chronicling the Beanie Baby craze of the late '90s. Are Tig and Cheryl "Beanie Ladies?" What do they make of the "Beanie Rap"? All that and more on a very Ty Inc. True Story!

item.title: The Real Bling Ring: Hollywood Heist
item.description:
This week, Tig and Cheryl take on the case of "The Real Bling Ring: Hollywood Heist," a sordid true crime tale told by the very cringeworthy millennial criminals who committed the string of celeb-targeting burglaries back in the '00s. Plus, does Tig own a Chanel bag? Just what is "Puss Town"? And much more!

item.title: Trainwreck: Woodstock 99
item.description:
The original Woodstock Music Festival was a legendary, generation-defining moment. The 1999 revival held at an abandoned military base?... not so much. Today on True Story, Tig and Cheryl score weekend passes to the continental precursor of the infamous Fyre Festival-- Woodstock 99. It's a rockin episode that, just like the fest, gets a little out of hand!

*this episode spills beans* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: Sins of Our Mother
item.description:

item.title: Introducing: Wolves Among Us, Season 1, The Larry Lavin Story
item.description:
On the surface, there was nothing remarkable about Larry Lavin. He lived in a quiet neighborhood with his wife and family, drove a Volvo, and practiced dentistry in Philadelphia. But, from 1978 to 1984, Dr. Lavin ran one of the largest cocaine enterprises on the entire eastern seaboard.


Through the voices and perspectives of law enforcement, drug runners, friends, business associates and Larry Lavin himself, Wolves Among Us, Season One, The Larry Lavin Story, tells the story of Lavin’s dual life, his impact on Philadelphia culture in the late 70s and early 80s, and the stunning events that led to his capture.

Wolves Among Us is a presentation and creation of Peabody-nominated C13Originals, a Cadence13 Studio.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Inside the Mind of a Cat
item.description:
Meow! Tig and Cheryl explore their feline sides as they leap into "Inside the Mind of a Cat," Netflix's documentary about the most mysterious of household pets. Our doc duo has VERY different reactions to the film, but you'll have to listen to find out who's purring, and who's hissing about this groundbreaking entry into the True Story canon!

item.title: Untold: The Girlfriend Who Didn't Exist
item.description:

item.title: The Speed Cubers
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl solve the riddle of "The Speed Cubers," a surprisingly emotional (not to spill beans!) look at the world of lightning fast Rubik's Cubers. Can a 3x3, color-coded cube be the secret to making Tig and/or Cheryl weep? You'll have to listen to today's episode to find out!

item.title: Shania Twain: Not Just A Girl (ep 100!)
item.description:
LET'S GO GIRLS!!! It's Tig and Cheryl's 100th episode of True Story, and they're celebrating with a recap of country-pop superstar Shania Twain's new Netflix doc! Plus all the tangents, braggadocious alerts, national headlines, and bean-spilling you've come to love over 100 hilarious episodes. Thanks for listening, snerkbols!

Tig and Cheryl sometimes struggle to keep their eyes open through docs... but the (very Floridian) true crime of "Dead Asleep" has them both wide awake! item.title: White Hot: The Rise & Fall of Abercrombie & Fitch
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl visit the mall-- specifically the shirtless-model-flanked, music-turned-up-to-11 teenage hellscape known as "White Hot: The Rise & Fall of Abercrombie & Fitch". Why were male models climbing trees? Why did Cheryl moonwalk out of an audition? What's Tig's connection to Spiderman? There's truly no way to know... not that it matters! *this episode spills beans* Get merch at podswag.com/truestory (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: Inventing David Geffen, with guest Rachael Harris!
item.description:
Rachael Harris joins Tig and Cheryl to talk about Hollywood mogul David Geffen, who smuggled drugs for David Crosby, dated Cher, and feuded with Neil Young! True Story has never been sillier, as Rachael identifies Cheryl as the "dramaturge" of the podcast, and teams up with Tig to derail her more than ever. *this episode spills beans* Get merch at podswag.com/truestory (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: Made You Look: A True Story About Fake Art
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl are the real deal, unlike the story profiled in "Made You Look," a captivating true crime doc about fake art sold for millions of dollars! item.title: A Secret Love
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl's (platonic) love for each other is entirely public, but today's doc, "A Secret Love," is a whole other story! The doc chronicles a 70-year lesbian relationship, and discussing it leads to one of the most hilarious, candid episodes of "True Story" to date. item.title: Val (Val Kilmer doc)
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl discuss Val Kilmer's autobiographical doc "Val," which features home video of the famously handsome (and difficult?) actor "goofing" with Tom Cruise, playing Batman, and falling in love. item.title: WeWork: Or the Making and Breaking of a $47 Billion Unicorn
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl take on their longest-titled doc ever, with Hulu's "WeWork: Or the Making and Breaking of a $47 Billion Unicorn." Much like Fyre Fest or Theranos, the doc turns a critical eye on a flashy startup that promised more than it could deliver. Cheryl tells an amazing story about a 5k, Tig discovers that Cheryl is in fact a unicorn, and much more! *this episode spills beans* get your True Story merch at podswag.com/truestory (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: Weiner (Anthony Weiner doc)
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl celebrate 4th of July with "Weiner," an inside look at Anthony Weiner's public meltdown as he runs to become mayor of New York. Tig and Cheryl share a laugh at Anthony's "Carlos Danger" alter ego, as well as sympathy for Huma Abedin and anger over how Huma was treated. It's an all-around Weiner roast! Unfortunately, they forget to use their signature catchphrase "Get Weiner!"... but it's still a great episode of True Story! *this episode spills beans* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com

item.title: Icarus
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl risk flying too close to the podcasting sun with their recap of "Icarus," the Oscar-winning Netflix doc about the Russian doping scandal that made NATIONAL HEADLINES. Who has the better Russian accent, Tig or Cheryl? Who were they attracted to, in a doc with a surprising amount of voluntary male nudity? All that and more, on a steroids-juiced episode of True Story! *this episode contains spoilers* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: Air Guitar Nation with Greg Behrendt!
item.description:
Greg Behrendt ("He's Just Not That Into You") joins Tig and Cheryl for "Air Guitar Nation," a chronicling of several contestants' quests to win the Air Guitar World Championships, a real event held annually in Finland. Greg, despite being featured in the documentary, barely remembers its contents... so he fits right in with Tig and Cheryl! They talk optimum pick placement, listen to a clip of horses galloping, and Greg facilitates the first-ever moment of learning on the podcast! *this episode spills beans* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: Tina
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl face the music as they delve into Tina Turner's tell-all doc, "Tina"! Available on HBO/HBO Max, "Tina" tells the story of the life and times of the legendary '80s rocker. item.title: The Wolfpack
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl laugh their way through "The Wolfpack," (or "Woofpack"?!), a doc about a family of six boys raised in a New York City apartment they are only rarely allowed to leave. Tig gives a shoutout to "My Octopus Teacher" winning an Oscar, Cheryl makes a declaration on the subject of tank tops vs sleeveless shirts, and "who are you attracted to" proves to be a more challenging question than usual! *this episode spills beans* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: Crip Camp: A Disability Revolution
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl talk Crip Camp, a Barack and Michelle Obama-produced doc about a hippy summer camp for the disabled that becomes a springboard for decades of civil rights activism. Amidst talk of crabs and slobby boyfriends, there are also some poignant moments... could this be the rare doc to make BOTH hosts cry? We won't spill the beans-- you'll just have to listen and find out. *this episode contains spoilers* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com

Tig and Cheryl tackle "Hands On A Hard Body," a charmingly heartfelt doc about a small-town Texas competition to win a pickup truck! item.title: The Imposter
item.description:
Today on True Story-- the return of True Crime! Tig and Cheryl delve into the gritty (just like Tig likes 'em) story of The Imposter-- a French guy who impersonates a Texas teen. Cheryl shares a garage sale story that has both of our hosts laughing hysterically, and Tig makes plans to impersonate Cheryl at her next family reunion. Plus, as always, we get to hear who was attractive/what made them cry! *this episode contains spoilers* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: Tiger (Tiger Woods doc)
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl discuss "Tiger," HBO's dive into the sometimes inspiring, sometimes scandalous life of the world's greatest golfer, Tiger Woods. Did Tig and Cheryl cry? Who did they find attractive? And can Tig convince Cheryl to finally "spill the beans" and get comfortable with sharing spoilers on the doc they're discussing? item.title: The Inventor: Out For Blood In Silicon Valley (Theranos doc)
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl discuss The Inventor: Out For Blood In Silicon Valley, a doc about the rise and fall of blood-testing company Theranos, operated by the one-time rising star of the startup world, Elizabeth Holmes. Talk of fax machines, kazoos, and certain venereal diseases send Tig and Cheryl into the hardest fit of laughter on the pod to date-- test results indicate that you're guaranteed to find this episode hilarious! *this episode contains spoilers* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: The Bee Gees: How Can You Mend A Broken Heart
item.description:
For the first True Story episode of 2021, Tig and Cheryl take a time machine back to the '70s and watch the new Bee Gees doc that covers the incredible highs and tragic lows of the legendary folk-R&B-disco band. Our favorite doc duo discusses the medallion-in-chest-hair look, which of the brothers is their favorite, and none other than Dane Cook himself gets discussed! *this episode contains spoilers* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: Tig (Netflix doc) with Stephanie Allynne
item.description:
It's been five years since the documentary "Tig" premiered at Sundance, and A TON has happened since! Stephanie Allynne (you know her from "L Word: Generation Q", not to mention the "Tig" doc!) joins Tig and Cheryl to discuss the documentary, and she and Tig give us an inside look at how it felt to watch, not to mention live, the documentary. Plus Tig, Cheryl, and Stephanie pick their favorite docs they watched in 2020. *this episode contains spoilers* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: My Octopus Teacher
item.description:
Join Tig and Cheryl as they dive in to the delightful undersea d-octo-mentary "My Octopus Teacher"! Tig talks about the experience of watching the doc with her sons, and Cheryl wonders if the documentarian ever had a sex dream about the octopus. It's one of the silliest, funniest episodes of True Story yet, and you don't want to miss it! *this episode contains spoilers* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: BONUS: Amanda Knox Interview!
item.description:
Today, on a very special BONUS episode of True Story, Amanda Knox herself pays a visit to the podcast to discuss the documentary that shares her name. Tig and Cheryl get answers on Amanda's police interrogation, her time in prison, and what her life is like now. Amanda gives our doc-duo a candid, behind the scenes look into a story that continues to attract controversy and fascination. (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.description:
Join Tig and Cheryl for a tour of an unfinished mega-mansion on the outskirts of Orlando, as they discuss the hit documentary "The Queen of Versailles"! item.title: Boys State
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl elect to discuss Boys State, a timely 2020 documentary following a group of teenage boys as they run for office at an annual  mock government summer camp held in Austin, Texas. Our hosts are impressed by the political ability of some of the boys-- but dismayed by the "talent show" portion of the doc. Tig also ponders why guys chant "hoo, hoo."

*this episode contains spoilers* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: Metallica: Some Kind of Monster
item.description:
Enter Sandman, as well as Tig and Cheryl, as our favorite doc-duo discusses this alternately heavy and hilarious documentary chronicling the interpersonal drama of one of the biggest rock acts of all time. From one band member's questionable fashion sense, to another's confident use of the word "squillions," Tig and Cheryl have plenty of insights and stories to share, whether you've seen the documentary or not! 

*this episode contains spoilers* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: The Staircase
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl take on their first true crime documentary with the classic docuseries The Staircase. Aside from analyzing whether an owl might have commited the crime, Cheryl can't get over the poor cooking skills of a convicted murderer, and Tig talks about a certain criminal defense attorney she feels could be her "type." 

*this episode contains spoilers* 

(tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: Marina Abramovic: The Artist Is Present
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl discuss daring performance artist Marina Abramovic on this extremely revealing (in more ways than one) episode of True Story! Our two hosts review which moments in the film made them cry, before nearly crying laughing at their recollections of performance art mishaps in their past. Plus, Tig talks about how Marina has personally inspired her.

 *This episode contains spoilers* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: Tiger King, with Director Eric Goode
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl welcome their first guest to the podcast, Tiger King director and producer Eric Goode! Tig and Cheryl get answers on some of their biggest questions about the bizarre world of Joe Exotic, Carole Baskin, and captive tigers, as Eric provides candid insight into the behind-the-scenes making of the biggest documentary of 2020.  

*This episode contains spoilers*

(tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: FYRE: The Greatest Party That Never Happened
item.description:
Tig and Cheryl discuss Fyre: The Greatest Party That Never Happened, a doc chronicling the most infamous fiasco in music festival history. The duo make plans to save the swimming pigs, review potential lessons Tig could learn from "The Secret", and debate how to talk (or not talk) about the birds and the bees with their respective kids. *This episode contains spoilers* (tigandcheryltruestory@gmail.com)

item.title: A Band Called Death
item.description:
On the very first episode of True Story, Tig and Cheryl discuss A Band Called Death, a doc about a trio of brothers who formed a '70s punk band in Detroit that gets rediscovered decades later. Tig shares a story about a firsthand experience with the band, and the two discuss their least favorite band names, include Hoobastank and "Chubbawubba."

*This episode contains spoilers!*

item.title: Announcing Tig and Cheryl: True Story!
item.description:
Tig Notaro (Star Trek, One Mississippi) and Cheryl Hines (Curb Your Enthusiasm) are excited to announce their new podcast! Every week they'll discuss a different documentary, with plenty of memorable stories and hilarity along the way.

 

Subscribe now-- the first episode of Tig and Cheryl: True Story arrives September 14th!
